marketNews.title: Other hot topics
marketNews.content: Antara reported that OJK is ready to gradually approve proposals to raise the minimum free-float to up to 30%, up from the current 7.5% and a proposed increase to 10% for listed companies. BEI is studying the rule while the House Commission chair suggested a 30% target. The Director General of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Eniya Listiani Dewi, said a new presidential regulation on waste-to-energy will be issued this week, requiring local governments to provide land and waste-handling fees and to guarantee feedstock for waste-to-energy plants for 30 years. Goldman Sachs raised its December 2026 gold price forecast to US$4,900 per ounce, citing strong central-bank buying and higher gold-backed ETF demand amid an expected Fed rate cut of 100 bps in mid-2026. The Malaysian Palm Oil Association said Malaysia’s palm-oil output fell 2.4% month-on-month to 1.81 million tonnes in September, a milder drop than Bloomberg’s -4.3% forecast, which could support palm-oil prices as Indian demand eases and colder weather shifts buyers to soybean oil. The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources issued Ministerial Regulation No. 17/2025, cutting the validity of work plans and budgets from three years to one year to give the government tighter control over production and commodity prices; the 2025 quota remains but companies must re-apply for 2026-27. Bank Indonesia reported that adjusted M0 grew 18.6% YoY to IDR 2,152.4 trillion in September, driven by a 37% YoY rise in bank-wide current deposits and a 13.5% rise in cash in circulation. The same agency said foreign-exchange reserves fell to US$148.7 billion at end-September, the lowest in 14 months, equal to 6.2 months of import coverage, above the 3-month adequacy standard.

marketNews.title: Menerka Faktor Dibalik Kaburnya Asing dari Saham Big Bank
marketNews.content: "Harga jatuh bukan karena bangkrut, tapi karena asing kabur seperti kesetanan." – skydrugz27

tickerNews.title: Garuda Indonesia private placement of US$1.85 billion with Danantara
tickerNews.content: Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) plans a private placement of approximately 407.9 billion new shares to PT Danantara Asset Management at an execution price of IDR 75 per share, resulting in a total transaction value of about US$1.85 billion (≈IDR 30.5 trillion). The transaction includes: 1) a cash capital contribution of up to US$1.44 billion; and 2) conversion of a shareholder loan of US$405 million. The private placement will dilute the public-shareholding from 27.46% to about 5.03%, while Danantara’s stake will rise from 64.54% to about 93.5%. The shareholder loan from Danantara was provided in June 2025 and fully drawn by GIAA on 18 September 2025. The capital-raising plan was first disclosed in July 2025 together with the 2Q25 audit announcement. The total private-placement amount is higher than the earlier reported US$1 billion support. The proceeds will be used for: 29% working capital and operations; 37% capital increase for Citilink to fund its working capital and operations, potentially to restore Citilink’s fleet; 22% expansion of the group and Citilink fleet (the group previously announced a plan to add more than 100 aircraft by 2029); and 12% to fund Citilink’s fuel-purchase debt to Pertamina. The private placement will be discussed at the extraordinary general meeting on 12 November 2025.

tickerNews.title: Ultra Jaya Milk Industry & Trading Company (ULTJ) in talks with FrieslandCampina
tickerNews.content: DealStreetAsia reported that the shareholder of Ultra Jaya Milk Industry & Trading Company (ULTJ) has started discussions with Dutch dairy cooperative FrieslandCampina about a minority share sale and a strategic partnership. The talks are exploratory and non-binding. The discussion also covers a long-term goal of full consolidation, according to DealStreetAsia. Both FrieslandCampina and its Indonesian unit Frisian Flag Indonesia declined to comment, and ULTJ has not confirmed the report.

tickerNews.title: Chandra Daya Investasi adds 4.7 MWp solar capacity in Cilegon
tickerNews.content: Chandra Daya Investasi, through its subsidiary PT Krakatau Chandra Energi, announced that an additional 4.7 MWp of solar power plant capacity will start operating in November 2025 in Cilegon, Banten, raising total installed capacity to 11 MWp. The company said it will continue to expand solar capacity step-by-step as part of its long-term strategy to support the transition to renewable energy.

tickerNews.title: PT Timah (TINS) meets miners’ demands on price and sales
tickerNews.content: PT Timah’s President Director Restu Widiyantoro said on Monday (6 Oct) that the company accepted four miners’ demands, including a tin price of IDR 300,000 for SN 70%, permission for miners to extract in the TINS-held mining concession provided the ore is sold to TINS, and the dissolution of the tin task force. The statement followed a miners’ protest in Bangka Belitung, which was reported by Media Indonesia, while Tempo reported the protest stemmed from concerns over the task force and government actions against illegal tin mining.

tickerNews.title: Merdeka Gold Resources raises Pani gold-ore reserve
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Gold Resources announced an increase in the gold-ore reserve for the Pani mine in Gorontalo from 1.9 million troy ounces to 4.8 million troy ounces, a rise of about 150%. The Pani mine began production on 1 October 2025 with a first-quarter 2026 gold output target.

tickerNews.title: Sentul City (BKSL) to sign 152-hectare land purchase from Genting
tickerNews.content: Sentul City clarified to the IDX that the deed of sale for 152 hectares worth IDR 2.05 trillion to PT Genting Properti Abadi is expected to be signed at the end of 2025. In July 2024 Genting announced a plan to buy the land from BKSL’s subsidiary PT Aftanesia Raya and a third party PT Primatama Cahaya Sentosa, which is not a BKSL subsidiary. In the July 2024 clarification, BKSL said the book value of the 152-hectare land to be acquired was IDR 11.4 billion per 1Q24. The parties did not disclose how the transaction proceeds would be split between Aftanesia Raya and Primatama Cahaya Sentosa.

tickerNews.title: Krakatau Steel (KRAS) debt restructuring settlement
tickerNews.content: Krakatau Steel announced that it obtained written approval from four private banks to settle accelerated obligations with a debt-restructuring concession. The total debt settled equals IDR 248.2 billion and US$159.1 million, while KRAS paid only IDR 49.6 billion and US$31.8 million, giving an ~80% principal reduction. The company also received a write-off of interest and penalties totaling IDR 112.9 billion and US$18.8 million. The agreement reduces debt by US$174.3 million from the US$1.4 billion restructured debt, lowering interest burden and cash-flow pressure.

tickerNews.title: Barito Renewables Energy (BREN) free-float increase
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Barito Renewables Energy, affiliated with Green Era Energy Pte. Ltd., sold approximately 481.2 million BREN shares on 2 October 2025 at an average price of IDR 8,650 per share, for a total transaction value of about IDR 4.2 trillion. The proceeds will increase the free-float. After the transaction, Green Era Energy’s stake fell from about 23.35% to about 22.99%.

tickerNews.title: Astra Graphia (ASGR) interim dividend 2025
tickerNews.content: Astra Graphia announced an interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 of approximately IDR 40.5 billion (IDR 30 per share), implying a dividend yield of about 2.5% on Tuesday 7 October. The dividend is payable on the regular market and in negotiations on 15 October, with payment on 24 October 2025.
